articles.author: Charlotte Greenfield
articles.description: Opium poppy production in Afghanistan, previously the world's top supplier, has plummeted since the Taliban administration banned the cultivation of narcotics last year, a United Nations report said on Sunday.
articles.title: Afghanistan opium poppy supply plummets 95% after Taliban ban - U.N.

articles.author: Brenda Goh
articles.description: Australia's Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, starting the first visit to China by a leader of his country in seven years, said on Sunday it was "in all our interests" to have a bilateral relationship with dialogue and cooperation.
articles.title: Australia's Albanese seeks dialogue, cooperation in China visit

articles.author: Chen Lin
articles.description: Singapore Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong said on Sunday that Deputy Prime Minister Lawrence Wong will take over from him as leader of the ruling People's Action Party before the next general election due by November 2025.
articles.title: Singapore deputy PM Wong to lead ruling party before general election - PM

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Uruguay's interior minister and two other members of the government resigned on Saturday over a case that has already prompted the foreign minister to quit, involving a passport issued to an internationally wanted drug-trafficking suspect.
articles.title: Uruguay government members resign over passport scandal probe

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Canada's police probe into the June murder of a Sikh separatist in British Columbia has been damaged by a high-level Canadian official's public statements, India's High Commissioner to Canada, Sanjay Kumar Verma, told the Globe and Mail in an interview published on Saturday.
articles.title: Indian diplomat says high-level Canadian official damaged probe into Sikh's murder

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Police were hunting for a man who stabbed and wounded a Jewish woman in the French city of Lyon on Saturday, while a swastika was found graffitied at her home, police and the city's mayor said.
articles.title: French police hunt suspect in stabbing of Jewish woman

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A light plane crashed in a remote area of Australia's Queensland state on Saturday, killing three firefighters who were on board, police said late on Saturday.
articles.title: Light plane crashes in remote Australia, three firefighters killed

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Simon Lewis, Suleiman, Al-Khalidi
articles.description: The United States and its Arab allies appeared divided over Israel's military offensive in Gaza to defeat Hamas, as Washington, alongside Israel, resisted pressure for an immediate ceasefire despite the rising death toll among Palestinian civilians.
articles.title: Arab world, US split on Gaza ceasefire as Israeli offensive presses on

articles.author: Maria Starkova
articles.description: Ukraine's defence minister ordered on Saturday an investigation into an alleged Russian ballistic missile attack on Ukrainian assault brigade, after reports that more than 20 soldiers were killed during an awards ceremony.
articles.title: Ukraine orders investigation into Russian attack on assault brigade

articles.author: Navesh Chitrakar, Yubaraj Sharma
articles.description: Sobbing relatives of victims from Nepal’s worst earthquake in eight years sat with the bodies of their loved ones on Sunday as rescuers looked for people who could still be trapped in the rubble of collapsed buildings.
articles.title: Sobbing relatives of Nepal quake victims prepare for cremations
